dct_title_s: J. De Cordova's map of the state of Texas
dct_alternative_sm: J. De Cordova's map of Texas
dct_description_sm: compiled from the records of the General Land Office by Robert Creutzbaur ; engraved by J. M. Atwood, New York.
Bar scale on map given in "Statute Miles."
Shows topography, vegetation, county boundaries, cities and towns, colonies, German settlements, land districts, roads, trading posts, and exploration routes.
Includes "Reference to land districts" and legend.
"Entered according to Act of Congress, on the 28th day of July, 1848 by J. De Cordova, in the Clerk's Office of the United States District Court for the District of Texas."
"Without my signature all copies of this map have been fraudulently obtained [signed in ink] J. De Cordova."
Several signed certifications to the map's correctness at lower left, accompanied by official State of Texas seals.
Inset map: [Overview of Texas including extent of Indian Territory and adjacent lands acquired by the United States as a result of the War with Mexico, 1846-1848].
dct_rights_sm: Image from the Warren Heckrotte Map Collection courtesy Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain.  There are no restrictions on use.  If you have questions, please contact the David Rumsey Map Center at rumseymapcenter@stanford.edu.
